00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:  l_parms.h
00051  *
00052  *  Description:  Header file for l_parms.c
00053  *
00054  *  Creation Date :  10-6-92 (Pulled into separate file 9-2-93)
00055  *
00056  *  Author:  John Gyllenhaal, Wen-mei Hwu
00057  *
00058  *  Revisions:
00059  *      Roger A. Bringmann - February 1993
00060  *      Modified for standard use within Lcode.
00061  *
00062  *      Brian Deitrich - September 1994
00063  *      Modified to alter the way parameters are handled.
00064 
00065  *      John C. Gyllenhaal - May 1998
00066  *      Enhanced load parameters to accept up to two equivalent names
00067  *      for a section.  This functionality was added to allow the Trimaran
00068  *      release to "rename" some IMPACT parameter sections (namely,
00069  *      global, file, arch, RegAlloc, Dependence, and Scheduler). 
00070  *
00071  *      Copyright (c) 1993 The Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois.
00072  *                         All rights reserved.
00073  *      The University of Illinois software License Agreement
00074  *      specifies the terms and conditions for redistribution.
00075 \*****************************************************************************/
00076 #ifndef L_PARMS_H
00077 #define L_PARMS_H
00078 
00079 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00080 #include <config.h>
00081 #include <stdio.h>
00082 
00083 #define PARM_LINE_MAX   2048    /* was 400 */
00084 #define PARM_BUF_MAX    1024    /* was 200 */
00085 #define PARM_LEVEL_MAX  20      /* was 10 */
00086 
00087 #define PARM_FORCE_PARM   1
00088 #define PARM_COMMAND_LINE 2
00089 #define PARM_ENVIRONMENT  3
00090 #define PARM_INTERNAL     4
00091 
00092 #define PARM_TABLE_HASH_SIZE    128     /* Must be power of 2 */
00093 #define NOT_USED      0
00094 #define USED          1
00095 
00096 #define PARM_NOT_USED  0
00097 #define NO_PARM_DEF    1
00098 #define MULT_PARM_DEF  2
00099 
00100 #define WARNINGS_ON    1
00101 #define WARNINGS_OFF   0
00102 
00103 
00104 typedef struct parm_table_node
00105 {
00106   char *name;
00107   char *user_name;
00108   char *value;
00109   char *parm_file_name;         /* used for error processing when converting
00110                                    value to real representation */
00111   int parm_line_no;             /* used for error processing when converting
00112                                    value to real representation */
00113   int used;                     /* 0=parm not used yet (NOT_USED),
00114                                    else parm has been used */
00115   struct parm_table_node *next_input;   /* points to next element that
00116                                            was input from the parms file. used
00117                                            for printing out of parameters when
00118                                            DUMP_PARMS bit is set */
00119   struct parm_table_node *next; /*points to next element in hash table */
00120 }
00121 Parm_Table_Node;
00122 
00123 typedef struct parm_table_list
00124 {
00125   Parm_Table_Node *head[PARM_TABLE_HASH_SIZE];
00126 }
00127 Parm_Table_List;
00128 
00129 typedef struct parm_warn_node
00130 {
00131   int flag;                     /* differentiates between NO_PARM_DEF,
00132                                    PARM_NOT_USED, and MULT_PARM_DEF */
00133   char *name;
00134   char *value;                  /* only used for MULT_PARM_DEF */
00135   char *old_value;              /* only used for MULT_PARM_DEF */
00136   char *section_name1;          /* Support aliased section names */
00137   char *section_name2;
00138   char *parm_file_name;         /* not used in NO_PARM_DEF */
00139   char *old_parm_file_name;     /* only used for MULT_PARM_DEF */
00140   int parm_line_no;             /* not used in NO_PARM_DEF */
00141   int old_parm_line_no;         /* only used for MULT_PARM_DEF */
00142   struct parm_warn_node *next;
00143 }
00144 Parm_Warn_Node;
00145 
00146 typedef struct parm_warn_list
00147 {
00148   Parm_Warn_Node *head;
00149 }
00150 Parm_Warn_List;
00151 
00152 typedef struct parm_macro_node
00153 {
00154   int from;                     /* Command line, environment, internal */
00155   int use_count;
00156   char *name;
00157   char *value;
00158   struct parm_macro_node *next;
00159 }
00160 Parm_Macro_Node;
00161 
00162 typedef struct parm_macro_list
00163 {
00164   Parm_Macro_Node *head;
00165 }
00166 Parm_Macro_List;
00167 
00168 typedef struct parm_parse_info_st
00169 {
00170   char line_buf[PARM_LINE_MAX]; /* The raw parm file line */
00171   char parm_buf[PARM_BUF_MAX];  /* The parameter being set */
00172   char setting[PARM_BUF_MAX];   /* The setting for the parameter */
00173   FILE *file;
00174   char *name;
00175   int line_no;
00176   Parm_Macro_List *command_line_list;
00177   Parm_Macro_List *internal_list[PARM_LEVEL_MAX];
00178   Parm_Table_List *parm_list;
00179   int internal_level;
00180   char *calc_ptr;
00181   int token;
00182   int value;
00183 }
00184 Parm_Parse_Info;
00185 
00186 typedef struct parm_section_info
00187 {
00188   char *name1;    /* Allow up to two different names for the same */
00189   char *name2;    /* section. name2 = NULL, if no alias. */
00190   void (*read_func) (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi);
00191   int found[PARM_LEVEL_MAX];
00192   Parm_Table_List *parm_list;
00193 }
00194 Parm_Section_Info;

00201 /* Parameter file prototypes (private prototypes moved to l_parms.c 5/27/98) */
00202 
00203 /* Using standard rules, get the parameter file to use from 1) the
00204  * command line, 2) the user's environment, or 3) default to 
00205  * 'default_std_parms'.
00206  */
00207   extern char *L_get_std_parm_name (char **argv, char **envp,
00208                                     char *env_var_name,
00209                                     char *default_std_parms);
00210 
00211 /* Create the external 'macro' list needed by L_load_parameters */
00212   extern Parm_Macro_List *L_create_external_macro_list (char **argv,
00213                                                         char **envp);
00214   extern Parm_Macro_List *L_create_external_macro_list_new (char **argv,
00215                                                             char **envp,
00216                                                             int *lastarg);
00217   extern void L_free_parm_macro_list (Parm_Macro_List * list);
00218 
00219 /* Used to read in parameter file section */
00220   extern void L_load_parameters (char *parm_file_name,
00221                                  Parm_Macro_List * command_line_macro_list,
00222                                  char *section,
00223                                  void (*read_func) (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi));
00224 
00225 /* Allow two names to be specified for a section (a new and old name).
00226  * Both names will be accepted for the parameter file section name.
00227  */
00228   extern void L_load_parameters_aliased (char *parm_file_name,
00229                                          Parm_Macro_List *
00230                                          command_line_macro_list,
00231                                          char *new_section_name,
00232                                          char *old_section_name,
00233                                          void (*read_func) (Parm_Parse_Info *
00234                                                             ppi));
00235 
00236 /* Used to read in parameters of each type */
00237   extern void L_read_parm_s (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi_in, char *name,
00238                              char **ptr);
00239   extern void L_read_parm_b (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi_in, char *name, int *ptr);
00240   extern void L_read_parm_i (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi_in, char *name, int *ptr);
00241   extern void L_read_parm_f (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi_in, char *name,
00242                              float *ptr);
00243   extern void L_read_parm_lf (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi_in, char *name,
00244                               double *ptr);
00245 
00246 /* These two functions should be called after all the parameter files
00247  * that can be read have been.
00248  */
00249   extern void L_warn_about_unused_macros (FILE * out,
00250                                           Parm_Macro_List * external_list);
00251   extern void L_show_parms_warnings (void);
00252 
00253 /*
00254  * Set to 1 to make L_parm_unknown punt.  Defaults to warn.
00255  */
00256   extern int L_punt_on_unknown_parm;
00257 
00258 /* 
00259  * Set to 1 to make the parm facility warn about old parameter section
00260  * names being used.  Defaults to "no warnings".  This allows mixing and
00261  * matching of new and old section names. -JCG 6/3/98
00262  */
00263   extern int L_warn_old_parm_section_name_used;
00264 
00265   extern char *L_parm_dump_file_name;
00266 /*
00267  * -- output file name for dump of parameter information that was read in.
00268  * -- default is set to stderr.
00269  */
00270 
00271 
00272   extern int L_warn_parm_not_used;
00273 /*
00274  *  -- when this is set to 1, these warnings are enabled.
00275  *  -- warning occurs because a parameter defined in the parameter
00276  *     file was not used in a read routine.
00277  */
00278 
00279   extern int L_warn_parm_not_defined;
00280 /*
00281  *  -- when this is set to 1, these warnings are enabled.
00282  *  -- warning occurs because a parameter called in the read
00283  *     routine is not defined in the parameter file.
00284  *  -- NOTE: A parameter that is not in the parameter file, but
00285  *     is forced on the command line will be read correctly.
00286  *     in this case, this warning will not occur.
00287  */
00288   extern int L_warn_dev_parm_not_defined;
00289 /* 
00290  * --  same as above except for development parms, specified with an
00291  *     '?' before the name.  Allows warnings to be turned off for
00292  *     development parameters.
00293  */
00294 
00295   extern int L_warn_parm_defined_twice;
00296 /*
00297  *  -- when this is set to 1, these warnings are enabled.
00298  *  -- warning occurs because a parameter has multiple definitions
00299  *     in the same parameter file.
00300  */
00301 
00302   extern int L_dump_parms;
00303 /*
00304  *  -- when this is set to 1, the parameters that are used
00305  *     by the calling routine are appended to the file pointed to
00306  *     by the global variable, L_parm_dump_file_name.
00307  *  -- this variable is defined as:
00308  *     extern char *L_parm_dump_file_name
00309  *  -- the default value for this variable is "stderr".
00310  */
00311 
00312   extern char *L_parm_warn_file_name;
00313 /*
00314  *  -- output file name for parameter warnings.
00315  *  -- default is set to stderr.
00316  */
00317 
00318   extern int L_pmatch (char *s1, char *s2);
00319

00321 }
00322 #endif

00324 
00325 /* Macros for reading/printing parameters 
00326  *
00327  * If standard C, use # to put quotes around 'parm', otherwise
00328  * put the quotes around parm manually.
00329  * See John Gyllenhaal if you have problems.
00330  */
00331 #if defined(__STDC__) || defined(__cplusplus)
00332 
00333 #define READ_PARM_S(ppi,parm) L_read_parm_s(ppi,#parm,&parm)
00334 #define READ_PARM_I(ppi,parm) L_read_parm_i(ppi,#parm,&parm)
00335 #define READ_PARM_B(ppi,parm) L_read_parm_b(ppi,#parm,&parm)
00336 
00337 #define PRINT_PARM_S(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %s;\n",#parm,parm)
00338 #define PRINT_PARM_I(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %i;\n",#parm,parm)
00339 #define PRINT_PARM_B(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %i;\n",#parm,parm)
00340 #define PRINT_PARM_B_YES_NO(out,parm) \
00341     (parm ? fprintf (out, "    %s = yes;\n", #parm) : \
00342      fprintf (out, "    %s = no;\n", #parm))
00343 #define PRINT_PARM_B_ON_OFF(out,parm) \
00344     (parm ? fprintf (out, "    %s = on;\n", #parm) : \
00345      fprintf (out, "    %s = off;\n", #parm))
00346 #define PRINT_PARM_F(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %f;\n",#parm,parm)
00347 #define PRINT_PARM_LF(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %lf;\n",#parm,parm)
00348 
00349 #else
00350 
00351 #define READ_PARM_S(ppi,parm) L_read_parm_s(ppi,"parm",&parm)
00352 #define READ_PARM_I(ppi,parm) L_read_parm_i(ppi,"parm",&parm)
00353 #define READ_PARM_B(ppi,parm) L_read_parm_b(ppi,"parm",&parm)
00354 
00355 #define PRINT_PARM_S(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %s;\n","parm",parm)
00356 #define PRINT_PARM_I(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %i;\n","parm",parm)
00357 #define PRINT_PARM_B(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %i;\n","parm",parm)
00358 #define PRINT_PARM_B_YES_NO(out,parm) \
00359     (parm ? fprintf (out, "    %s = yes;\n", "parm") : \
00360      fprintf (out, "    %s = no;\n", "parm"))
00361 #define PRINT_PARM_B_ON_OFF(out,parm) \
00362     (parm ? fprintf (out, "    %s = on;\n", "parm") : \
00363      fprintf (out, "    %s = off;\n", "parm"))
00364 #define PRINT_PARM_F(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %f;\n","parm",parm)
00365 #define PRINT_PARM_LF(out,parm) fprintf (out, "    %s = %lf;\n","parm",parm)
00366 #endif
00367 
00368 #endif
